Yes, we miss our students and normalcy more than anything! Daily, I have been blown away by everyone stepping up and getting the task at hand, done. We are better together, but we will get through this!

You see, we don't just get lessons and growth and strength out of the tough stuff of life. We also get an abundance of wonderful stories: stories of valor, strength, grit, heroism, and humor that warm the heart and encourage the soul: stories that elevate us and help us see behind our immediate circumstances: stories that help us appreciate the wonder of our possibilities. Through these wonderful stories, perspective is enhanced, lives are changed and the world advances. -Brad Barton

Good Morning WPS parents and students: Online learning for students will officially be starting March 30th. I am sorry for any confusion, but plans have been changing day to day. The WPS staff will be using this week to prepare and get comfortable with our online platforms. We are working on posting plans on the school website. Staff will also use this time to reach out to students if they haven’t already. This next week I would rather place more emphasis on our students’ well-being rather than academics. Students can still be reading and doing online practice. I realize parents are trying to balance working from home and their child’s schooling. Please use this time as a family as we adjust into our new roles.

We request that on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday you contact the school to schedule a time to pick up your child’s personal belongings such as instruments, items in lockers, and items in desks. We will bag them up and deliver them to you curbside.

Remember we are continuing to offer free lunch and now breakfast so please contact the school if you are interested.
